intro: Gymnopoma tripolium, commonly known as the Mediterranean thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by round, fleshy fruits resembling apples. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough, hairy texture. The species is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
